document.heading: Pennsylvania Avenue Development Area Emergency Park and Plaza Preservation Act of 1994, Bill I0-657

history.narrative: Law 10-221, the “District of Columbia Board of Education Fees for Select Adult, Community, and Continuing Education Courses Act of 1994,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-656, which was referred to the Committee on Education and Libraries. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 1, 1994, and December 6, 1994, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 15, 1994, it was assigned Act No. 10-358 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-221 became effective on March 16, 1995.
